item.title: ::item problem, it should be for admins+ but its owner only :(
item.dc:creator: @Whino Whino
item.description:
@Whino wrote:

[quote=“vManlyMan, post:7, topic:409514”][quote author=AnonymousZ link=topic=510794.msg3706668#msg3706668 date=1313087134]
The String arg length number has nothing to do with the player rights.

You’re command is fine, you’ve more than likely put it under the wrong public void.

You’ll find it under ‘public void owner commands’ or something.

Copy and paste the ::item command into the ‘public void administrator commands’.

Enjoy…
[/quote]

I know, sorry about posting that. I’m not really thinking right now, and havent worked with private servers in a really long time. (except for a few weeks ago when I was working on dungeoneering).[/quote]
Dude, when i did that i made it thank you guys for helping:)

Read full topic

item.title: ::item problem, it should be for admins+ but its owner only :(
item.dc:creator: @AnonymousZ AnonymousZ
item.description:
@AnonymousZ wrote:

The String arg length number has nothing to do with the player rights.

You’re command is fine, you’ve more than likely put it under the wrong public void.

You’ll find it under ‘public void owner commands’ or something.

Copy and paste the ::item command into the ‘public void administrator commands’.

Enjoy…

item.title: ::item problem, it should be for admins+ but its owner only :(
item.dc:creator: @vManlyMan vManlyMan
item.description:
@vManlyMan wrote:

6th line down. Change that 3 to a 2.

3 = Owner
2= Admin
1= Moderator
0 = Normal player

item.title: ::item problem, it should be for admins+ but its owner only :(
item.dc:creator: @Whino Whino
item.description:
@Whino wrote:

Hey guys

I have a problem that i hope you can help me with

My ::item command should be for admin+, but it is for owners only, here’s the code.

[code] if (playerCommand.startsWith(“item”)
try {
String[] args =

playerCommand.split(" ");
if (args.length ==

  1. {
    int

newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
int

newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
if

((newItemID <= 20500) && (newItemID >= 0)) {

c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
} else {

c.sendMessage(“That item ID does not exist.”);
}
} else {

c.sendMessage("Wrong usage: (Ex:(::pickup_ID_Amount)(::item 995

1))");
}
} catch(Exception e) {

			} // HERE?
			} // HERE?
			[/code]

I know i’m a noob
BTW, its PI
Thanks guys! Really appreciate the help
